message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper proposes a hybrid ARQ scheme for polar codes, which is a topic related to information theory and communication systems. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.COMM (Communications and Networking) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also involves channel polarization, which is a technique used in system and control theory, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also involves updating reliabilities and relocating bits, which are related to data structures and algorithms, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves simulation and performance evaluation, which are related to machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category.
